---
title: "git_provided.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for storage using Git as the storage type. It specifies the repository URL for a Git-based storage system.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The `storage` key is the root-level configuration block that defines the storage settings for the application or system.

#### Internal Logic
The `storage` block contains two sub-keys: `type` and `git`, which together specify the storage configuration details.

___

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the type of storage to be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of storage, set to "git" in this case |

___

### `storage.git`
#### Description
Contains the configuration specific to Git-based storage.

#### Internal Logic
This block includes the `repository` key, which specifies the Git repository URL.

___

### `storage.git.repository`
#### Description
Defines the URL of the Git repository to be used for storage.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| repository | string | The Git repository URL in SSH format |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| storage.type | string | "git" | Specifies the storage type as Git |
| storage.git.repository | string | "git@github.com:foo/bar.git" | The SSH URL of the Git repository to be used for storage |

Note: This configuration file is likely part of a larger system that uses Git repositories for data storage or version control. The SSH format of the repository URL suggests that authentication will be handled through SSH keys.
